title: Pennsylvania State Game Lands Number 147
text:
The Pennsylvania State Game Lands Number 147 are <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20Game%20Lands">Pennsylvania State Game Lands</a> in <a href="Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Blair</a> <a href="County%20%28United%20States%29">County</a> in <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> providing hunting, trapping, bird watching, and other activities.
Geography.
Game Lands Number 147 is located on the slopes of <a href="Dunning%20Mountain">Dunning Mountain</a> south of the pass containing the <a href="Frankstown%20Branch%20Juniata%20River">Frankstown Branch</a> of the <a href="Juniata%20River">Juniata River</a>. It consists of four parcels located in <a href="Blair%20Township%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Blair</a>, <a href="Frankstown%20Township%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Frankstown</a>, <a href="Huston%20Township%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Huston</a>, <a href="Taylor%20Township%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Taylor</a>, and <a href="Woodbury%20Township%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Woodbury</a> <a href="Township%20%28Pennsylvania%29">townships</a>. <a href="Altoona%2C%20Pennsylvania">Altoona</a> is located about northwest of the Game Lands. <a href="Canoe%20Creek%20State%20Park">Canoe Creek State Park</a> is located to the west of the northern end of the Game Lands, Morrison's Cove Memorial Park is located in <a href="Martinsburg%2C%20Pennsylvania">Martinsburg</a> to the south, Taylor Park is located in <a href="Roaring%20Spring%2C%20Pennsylvania">Roaring Spring</a> to the southwest, and the <a href="Allegheny%20Portage%20Railroad%20National%20Historic%20Site">Allegheny Portage Railroad National Historic Site</a> is located west of the Game Lands. <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20Game%20Lands%20Number%20166">Pennsylvania State Game Lands Number 166</a> is to the north, <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20Game%20Lands%20Number%20118">Number 118</a> and <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20Game%20Lands%20Number%2073">Number 73</a> are to the east, <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20Game%20Lands%20Number%2041">Number 41</a> is to the south, and <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20Game%20Lands%20Number%20198">Pennsylvania State Game Lands Number 198</a> is to the west.
SGL 147 is drained by the <a href="Frankstown%20Branch%20Juniata%20River">Frankstown Branch</a> of the <a href="Juniata%20River">Juniata River</a> and its tributaries, part of the <a href="Susquehanna%20River">Susquehanna River</a> <a href="Drainage%20basin">watershed</a>. Nearby communities include the <a href="Borough%20%28Pennsylvania%29">boroughs</a> of <a href="Hollidaysburg%2C%20Pennsylvania">Hollidaysburg</a>, <a href="Martinsburg%2C%20Pennsylvania">Martinsburg</a>, <a href="Roaring%20Spring%2C%20Pennsylvania">Roaring Spring</a>, and <a href="Williamsburg%2C%20Pennsylvania">Williamsburg</a>, and the <a href="unincorporated%20area">unincorporated communities</a> <a href="Canoe%20Creek%2C%20Pennsylvania">Canoe Creek</a>, <a href="Clappertown%2C%20Pennsylvania">Clappertown</a>, <a href="East%20Freedom%2C%20Pennsylvania">East Freedom</a>, <a href="East%20Sharpsburg%2C%20Pennsylvania">East Sharpsburg</a>, Flowing Spring, <a href="Franklin%20Forge%2C%20Pennsylvania">Franklin Forge</a>, <a href="Frankstown%2C%20Pennsylvania">Frankstown</a>, <a href="Ganister%2C%20Pennsylvania">Ganister</a>, <a href="Geeseytown%2C%20Pennsylvania">Geeseytown</a>, Horrell, <a href="Jugtown%2C%20Pennsylvania">Jugtown</a>, <a href="Linds%20Crossing%2C%20Pennsylvania">Linds Crossing</a>, <a href="Loop%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Loop</a>, <a href="McKee%2C%20Pennsylvania">McKee</a>, <a href="Point%20View%2C%20Pennsylvania">Point View</a>, <a href="Reese%2C%20Pennsylvania">Reese</a>, <a href="Reservoir%2C%20Pennsylvania">Reservoir</a>, Rodman, <a href="Royer%2C%20Pennsylvania">Royer</a>, Springfield Junction, <a href="St.%20Clair%2C%20Blair%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">St. Clair</a>, <a href="Upper%20Reese">Upper Reese</a>, and Wertz.
<a href="Pennsylvania%20Route%20866">Pennsylvania Route 866</a> is north/south oriented near the east side of the Game Lands from north of Williamsburg and runs through Martinsburg, intersecting with <a href="Pennsylvania%20Route%20164">Pennsylvania Route 164</a> which touches the northern boundary of the southernmost parcel. Route 164 intersects with the highway carrying <a href="Interstate%2099">Interstate 99</a> and <a href="U.S.%20Route%20220">U.S. Route 220</a> to the west of the Game Lands. <a href="U.S.%20Route%2022">U.S. Route 22</a> runs through Hollidaysburg and crosses through the Frankstown Branch <a href="water%20gap">water gap</a> between SGL 147 and SGL 166. <a href="Pennsylvania%20Route%2036">Pennsylvania Route 36</a> also intersects with Route 164 in Roaring Spring.
Statistics.
SGL 147 was entered into the <a href="Geographic%20Names%20Information%20System">Geographic Names Information System</a> on 2 August 1979 as identification number 1188451, listing the elevation as . It consists of a total of in three parcels. Elevations range from on the northeast slope to in the main parcel.
Biology.
The Game Lands is dominated by deciduous and coniferous forest, with streams, herbaceous and unvegetated areas, 96.1% forested mostly hardwoods including oaks, also including mountain boulder fields. Hunting, trapping and furtaking opportunities include <a href="American%20black%20bear">bear</a> ("Ursus americanus"), <a href="Coyote">Coyote</a> ("Canis latrans"), <a href="Mourning%20dove">Mourning dove</a> ("Zenaida macroura"), <a href="White-tailed%20deer">deer</a> ("Odocoileus virgianus"), <a href="Ruffed%20grouse">Ruffed grouse</a> ("Bonasa umbellus"), <a href="Virginia%20opossum">opossum</a> ("Didelphis virginiana"), <a href="Common%20pheasant">Common pheasant</a> ("Phasianus colchicus"), <a href="Eastern%20cottontail">rabbit</a> ("Sylvilgus floridanus"), <a href="Raccoon">Raccoon</a> ("Procyon lotor"), <a href="Eastern%20gray%20squirrel">squirrel</a> ("Sciurus carolinensis"), and <a href="Wild%20turkey">turkey</a> ("Meleagris gallopavo"). Birdwatching species of interest include <a href="Broad-winged%20hawk">Broad-winged hawk</a> ("Buteo platypeterus"), <a href="Scarlet%20tanager">Scarlet tanager</a> ("Piranga olivacea"), <a href="Wood%20thrush">Wood thrush</a> ("Hylocichla mustelina"), <a href="Black-throated%20green%20warbler">Black-throated green warbler</a> ("Setophaga virens"), <a href="Cerulean%20warbler">Cerulean warbler</a> ("Setophaga cerulea"), <a href="Worm-eating%20warbler">Worm-eating warbler</a> ("Helmitheros vermivorum"), and <a href="Louisiana%20waterthrush">Louisiana waterthrush</a> ("Parkesia motacilla").
